thread.title: Brazil's GPA says quarterly income rises 7.5 percent

title: Brazil's GPA says quarterly income rises 7.5 percent
text:
April 13, 2018 / 12:16 PM / Updated 10 minutes ago CORRECTED-Brazil's GPA says quarterly revenue rises 7.5 percent Reuters Staff 1 Min Read 
(Corrects to say that numbers reflect net revenue, not net income) 
SAO PAULO, April 13 (Reuters) - Brazilian retailer GPA said net revenue rose 7.5 percent in the first quarter from a year ago to 11.34 billion reais ($3.33 billion). 
Same store sales at the retailer, a measure of sales at stores open for at least 12 months, grew 4.4 percent, the company said in a securities filing on Friday. $1 = 3.40 reais Reporting by Gram Slattery, Editing by Franklin Paul
